definition: Wong Tai Sin district of Kowloon, Hong Kong
surname Huang or Hwang
yellow/pornographic/to fall through
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
variant of 仙[xian1]
immortal

sentences.english: The Wong Tai Sin Temple is much older than the surrounding high-rise buildings.
sentences.chinese: 黄大仙祠比较周围的高楼大厦年代久远得多。

sentences.english: Temple outside a large Church, on the "Pinus densiflora Wong Tai Sin Temple of the biest".
sentences.chinese: 祠外的一个大牌坊，上着“赤松黄大仙祠”的大字。

sentences.english: The Wong Tai Sin Temple is one of Hong Kong's most renowned temples.
sentences.chinese: 黄大仙祠是香港最著名的庙宇之一。

sentences.english: Wong Tai Sin Temple is one of the most worshipped temples in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 黄大仙祠是香港最多人参拜及占卜的庙宇之一。

sentences.english: Not only Che Kung, but also Wong Tai Sin said the semblable answer.
sentences.chinese: 不论是车公，抑或黄大仙，他们的答案也是类似的。

definition: see 黃鼬|黄鼬[huang2 you4]
Tudi Gong, the God of the earth
acolyte in charge of incense in a temple
great immortal
monster/devil
sorcerer

Buddha (term of respect for Sakyamuni 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼[Shi4 jia1 mou2 ni2])/His Holiness (refers to a Buddhist grandee)/Buddha/God/emperor/in late Qing court, refers exclusively to Empress Dowager Cixi 慈禧太后[Ci2 xi3 tai4 hou4]
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
efficacious/effective/(of a prediction) accurate/correct
female immortal/sorceress
Lü Dongbin (796-), Tang Dynasty scholar, one of the Eight Immortals 八仙[Ba1 xian1]
to burn incense and worship Buddha
Daoist immortal/supernatural entity/(in modern fiction) fairy, elf, leprechaun etc/fig. lighthearted person
Jigong or Daoji (1130-1207), Southern Song Dynasty Buddhist monk
see 李鐵拐|李铁拐[Li3 Tie3 guai3]
(of a supernatural or divine being) to appear/to make itself manifest
